metadata.title: Naupliar Development of Metridia Pacific (Copepoda Calanoida) Reared in the Laboratory
metadata.description: To describe the Nauplii taxa and recruitment in the Aleutian basin.  A key to the identification of the Naupliar stages is provided.
metadata.notes:
Purpose: To describe the Nauplii taxa and recruitment in the Aleutian basin.  A key to the identification of the Naupliar stages is provided.

Status: Complete

metadata.title: Archeological Remains of Fish, Mammals and Birds from the Western Aleutians (Shemya & Buldir Islands) Dated to 3,000 - 3,500 B.P.
metadata.description: Archeological remains of fish, mammals and birds from the western Aleutians (Shemya & Buldir Islands) dated to 3,000 - 3,500 B.P.  Our company has identified fish only - data set contains Pacific cod, pollock, halibut, Atka mackerel, rockfish, other flatfish, sculpins, etc;...bones well preserved
metadata.notes:
Purpose: Used to reconstruct environmental conditions and compare resource use over time by indigenous people.  Potential additional uses include making size estimates and constructing age profiles of populations over time and also DNA sample sources ( e.g., sea otter, fur seal, etc..)

Status: In Progress

Maintenance frequency: As Needed

Access constraints: Should be publically available after publication

Use constraints: None on data.  Further analysis (e.g., DNA) on bone may require permission.

metadata.title: NCDC Monthly Temperature Anomalies
metadata.description: NCDC Monthly Temperature Anomalies (1856-1994)   The data set of Monthly Temperature Anomalies was developed at The  National Climatic Data Center (NCDC). In June 1995, the NOAA Baseline Temperature dataset was merged with a gridded data set of sea surface temperatures to give a truly global anomaly product. The ocean dataset is a compilation of data from the United Kingdom Meteorological Office and the Comprehensive Oceanic and Atmospheric Data Set (COADS). Monthly updates are performed by ERL using the GTS ship reports. This dataset extends from 1856 to 1994.
metadata.notes:
Status: In Progress

Maintenance frequency: Unknown

Access constraints: None.

Use constraints: None.

metadata.title: Arctic CTD Data Collated under ESDIM Data Rescue
metadata.description: CTD:  High resolution vertical profiles of conductivity, temperature, and pressure.  Additional sensors may include dissolved oxygen or other biological/chemical sensors (nephelometers, flurometers).
metadata.notes:
Purpose: To collect, record and preserve high resolution vertical profiles of conductivity, temperature, and depth (CTD).

metadata.title: Arctic Ice Dynamics Joint Experiment - Camp Data

creators.name: National Snow and Ice Data Center (NSIDC)

metadata.description: During summer 1975, the Arctic Ice Dynamics Joint Experiment (AIDJEX) maintained 4 manned camps on ice floes in the Arctic Ocean.  Instrumentation recorded surface and geostrophic winds, ocean current velocity at 2 and 30 meter depths, and camp (floe) position.  Data available are daily average values for each parameter at each camp, as well as ice velocity and smoothed position data.  Surface pressure and geostrophic wind data at 6-hourly intervals are also available.
metadata.notes:
Purpose: To obtain data on instrumentation recorded surface and geostrophic winds, ocean current velocity at 2 and 30 meter depths, and camp (floe) position.

Status: Complete

Maintenance frequency: Unknown

Access constraints: None

Use constraints: There are no restrictions on the distribution of this data.
